name: Interviewer
line: I am so excited to be here with jim mckelvey and jack dorsey square's two co-founders to talk about.

name: Dorsey
line: Um all things square and how it started what the origination was.

name: Interviewer
line: And how we're thinking about the developer community so for those of you who don't know.

name: Dorsey
line: Square started because jim who owns a glassblowing factory uh was unable to process a payment and.

name: Interviewer
line: Was really bothered by that understandably about losing customers and started pairing up with his pal.

name: Dorsey
line: Jack and they came up with this solution um so i'd love to hear from the two of you.

name: Interviewer
line: Um how you first connected before square even was born so um jack came to work for me.

name: Dorsey
line: At a company that i actually still have um but at the time we were uh very poorly.

name: Interviewer
line: Managed and supplemented our bad management with his uh mother's product which was uh.

name: Dorsey
line: Chocolate covered coffee beans which we would chew up and uh keep the staff awake so marcia.

name: Interviewer
line: Dorsey was effectively our dealer um and we found one day that her son liked computers that's all we knew.

name: Dorsey
line: And so my partner invited john invited jack to come over to work with us and he happened to show.

name: Interviewer
line: Up in the middle of this chaotic mess and uh pulled an all-nighter with us the first night.

name: Dorsey
line: So we sent him home at five in the morning and i guess i'll let jack finish the story since i think it goes on from.

name: Interviewer
line: There well i got yelled at by my mom she um she hated jim um cursed his name.

name: Dorsey
line: To this day but has forgiven him for some things but no i might.

name: Interviewer
line: My parents always encouraged me to follow my own path and competing was one one big part of.

name: Dorsey
line: That and uh jim's company and that work was a great way for me to experience.

name: Interviewer
line: What i ultimately wanted to do which was programming and i was super early in the programming computers at that.

name: Dorsey
line: Point another story some of you may not know is square's very first customer.

name: Interviewer
line: Was a woman named sherry who owned lily bell flowers in san francisco and when jack and jim finally had a.

name: Dorsey
line: Prototype for their hardware they approached her at a market and asked her if she wanted to try it out.

name: Interviewer
line: Uh taking credit card payments she showed a little bit of hesitancy and wasn't quite sure but just as they were.

name: Dorsey
line: Having that conversation a customer a potential customer walked up to her um and said that he didn't.

name: Interviewer
line: Have any cash but he would go get someone come back and so they waited around and waited around and lo and.

name: Dorsey
line: Behold the customer never returned and so that really.

name: Interviewer
line: Helped just fuel even more so the need to create this hardware and provide this to.

name: Dorsey
line: Sellers who are trying to capture every type of payment um so i'd really love to hear how does.

name: Interviewer
line: This kind of customer centricity lead to innovation well i it wasn't one time that we did that like.

name: Dorsey
line: We went on a cherry multiple times um and asked her if she would try or work on and she.

name: Interviewer
line: Repeatedly said no um until the point when she lost the sale and that was the biggest insight we we.

name: Dorsey
line: Originally thought that we were building a credit card reader that plugged in the.

name: Interviewer
line: Phone and had an easy app that got you to the visa or mastercard or.

name: Dorsey
line: Acquiring gateway but ultimately what we learned in that moment and it we didn't i don't think we.

name: Interviewer
line: Realized it in that moment but what we learned over time was it wasn't about building.

name: Dorsey
line: The credit card reader is about making the sale helping installer make the sale if we.

name: Interviewer
line: Focused only on building a little plastic device that plugged into the headphone jack and built some.

name: Dorsey
line: Software around that would be a very very small not very impactful company but because we focused on a deeper.

name: Interviewer
line: Problem which was how do we help us all and make the sale in the first place.

name: Dorsey
line: We expanded our entire universe of solutions so a credit card reader is one solution that point of sale is another.

name: Interviewer
line: Solution because it allows someone to see their entire business and.

name: Dorsey
line: Get analytics around how they're doing and make better decisions lending is another solution.

name: Interviewer
line: Which came in the form of square capital and so on and so forth so by by going a little bit deeper into.

name: Dorsey
line: The observation what we're seeing we created something much more valuable than.

name: Interviewer
line: What we started with yeah it was also interesting when we got the first ipad uh.

name: Dorsey
line: Because instead of being restrained to you know this much screen area we had a full ipad's worth.

name: Interviewer
line: And so that naturally led us to thinking about all the other things that our customers had to do we had some.

name: Dorsey
line: Customers at that point but not very many um at least not compared to today and.

name: Interviewer
line: It's really interesting if you think of payments as this.

name: Dorsey
line: Wonderfully honest form of communication you know what you spend your money on are things you value.

name: Interviewer
line: What you think spend your money on is is almost as important as what you spend your time on in some ways.

name: Dorsey
line: And so it's a really interesting insight into what matters for a business and if you start connecting to that.

name: Interviewer
line: It naturally leads to a very rich ecosystem that's awesome uh talk to me about how.

name: Dorsey
line: You engage with the developer communities as you're building up square were there.

name: Interviewer
line: Certain forms that you all used or communities that you contributed to how do you think that's changed if.

name: Dorsey
line: Any uh to today when we first started we didn't i mean we consciously decided not to.

name: Interviewer
line: Engage with the developer community because we you know we had we had a bunch of.

name: Dorsey
line: Experience with apis in the past and like how much um they could potentially be abused.

name: Interviewer
line: And given that we were dealing with money and moving money around we want to make.

name: Dorsey
line: Sure we had a lot of control over how our system was working and we'd have enough people staff.

name: Interviewer
line: Engineering resources to make sure that we could build the right constraints um to start so we we didn't really start.

name: Dorsey
line: With the developer community until a few years in um and again it was a conscious choice our.

name: Interviewer
line: First focus was one specific customer which was a seller who otherwise would not be able to.

name: Dorsey
line: Accept a credit card and we just stayed focused until we had a much stronger base and a greater.

name: Interviewer
line: Understanding of where to go from there and then as we got the right engineering talent.

name: Dorsey
line: And we understood like what we were building and we understood like what the right.

name: Interviewer
line: Endpoints were we started building out the developer community.

name: Dorsey
line: And um a lot of it came from you know just making sure that anything we build internally.

name: Interviewer
line: Ultimately could we export it externally like we should be a client of our own platform.

name: Dorsey
line: Ideally and that's how we originally started building the the system and.

name: Interviewer
line: You know in many cases we succeeded in some cases we failed but we're up we're able to learn very fast.

name: Dorsey
line: And build a platform that i think you know not only exposes a bunch of.

name: Interviewer
line: New functionality to the world especially around commerce for sellers but also encourages entirely new ways of.

name: Dorsey
line: Doing commerce and doing business and that's just on the seller side we have much more work to do.

name: Interviewer
line: On the cash up side which is super exciting as well i'd also add that you know there's sort.

name: Dorsey
line: Of an inherent respect for the development community because both jack and i are engineers.

name: Interviewer
line: So it's sort of odd to have a company founded by two technical folks but um you know i remember back.

name: Dorsey
line: Even when jack was working with me almost 30 years ago he was contributing uh to the open source community he was.

name: Interviewer
line: Writing for linux i remember uh twiddler the uh corded input device that you wrote a driver for.

name: Dorsey
line: Um and uh you know that plus open source has been an area of you know sort of.

name: Interviewer
line: Deep respect and so i think although we kind of came to it late uh i think we came to it well and i.

name: Dorsey
line: Think you see that respect in the products that square offers and the way we treat developers.

name: Interviewer
line: I want to switch now to talking about uh support and and how we think about the interactions.

name: Dorsey
line: That our sellers have with us as lauren mentioned i have the privilege of leading the customer success team.

name: Interviewer
line: Here at square so my team knows definitely how critical it is that we are providing great.

name: Dorsey
line: Experiences to our sellers and helping them through really critical time sensitive initiatives.

name: Interviewer
line: Um that are really challenging to their business so i'd love to hear from you what connections does square enable for.

name: Dorsey
line: Its sellers so i i think the most important thing that square does for the sellers is it.

name: Interviewer
line: Makes much of the tedium invisible in other words if you use square if you're part.

name: Dorsey
line: Of our ecosystem and you're running your business you can spend just a little more time focused on.

name: Interviewer
line: Your business as opposed to worrying about accounting withholding and you know paying off this.

name: Dorsey
line: Loan and managing all these various connections and one of the great uh tragedies.

name: Interviewer
line: That people experience is they're good at something they've got this skill and they say oh i'm good enough i'm going to.

name: Dorsey
line: Open a business and then when they open that business they realize that they don't get to.

name: Interviewer
line: Actually do the thing they're good at because they're buried with all this other stuff and so.

name: Dorsey
line: What we've always tried to do with square is is just sort of make those problems go.

name: Interviewer
line: Away and uh you know jack and always jack and i always discussed in the early days.

name: Dorsey
line: How the ultimate success would not be famous but would to be invisible to actually be this utility layer that.

name: Interviewer
line: Didn't get noticed and i think we still aspire to that and to the extent that people use our products without even.

name: Dorsey
line: Realizing how much is going into those products it's a big win i have anything to add there no i mean.

name: Interviewer
line: Our the name of our company kind of indicates what we want to be which is plain um.

name: Dorsey
line: Out of sight foundational pouring we we didn't want to put our brand before.

name: Interviewer
line: Our customers ultimately whether the customer be our seller or a developer.

name: Dorsey
line: We we wanted to fade into the background as much as we could and we chose the name accordingly it's a.

name: Interviewer
line: Boring brand by design um and uh you know when we were first.

name: Dorsey
line: Talking to our designers and brand people they got so upset and insulted that we.

name: Interviewer
line: Wanted to build a boring brand because their work is anything but but it takes a lot of work to build.

name: Dorsey
line: Something that is so a brand that is so foundational and um nondescript and invisible.

name: Interviewer
line: That it is apparent we had a lot going for us and just our hardware the shape of our reader.

name: Dorsey
line: Was our name the the structure of our first ipad register indicated the same shape even though it.

name: Interviewer
line: Wasn't exactly that so we relied a lot upon what people put on top of their counter.

name: Dorsey
line: To reference our brand more so than having a flashy name or something that was truly in your.

name: Interviewer
line: Face yeah if you're excited about your payment system it's probably negative.

name: Dorsey
line: Energy that's true very true uh jim i'd love to hear how do the connections that square.

name: Interviewer
line: Creates uh fit into the notion of the innovation stack.

name: Dorsey
line: So i was confounded by something that happened at square which is that we survived an attack by amazon when we.

name: Interviewer
line: Were still a startup and i couldn't answer the question.

name: Dorsey
line: How did we survive and so what i did was i went on this it was basically a two year research.

name: Interviewer
line: Quest looking at other companies that had been in the same situation and i discovered something that was.

name: Dorsey
line: Really interesting which was that all the companies that had been in similarly.

name: Interviewer
line: Deadly situations and had survived and thrived were all focused on very very small.

name: Dorsey
line: Customers and enabling people who had essentially been excluded from the market.

name: Interviewer
line: And this was true in banking it was true and furniture was true and in transportation and i found hundreds.

name: Dorsey
line: Of examples of of this phenomenon and and when i sort of dove down into it what i saw.

name: Interviewer
line: Was that at the core with something i sort of had to come up with a name for i called it an innovation stack and it's.

name: Dorsey
line: It's the mess that you have to create when you're doing something new and that was sort of the big insight of.

name: Interviewer
line: The book which is that square because we were trying to serve customers who were basically excluded.

name: Dorsey
line: From normal rails of commerce as as i was you know as a small glassblower but you.

name: Interviewer
line: Know as my friends were like i know it was to be left out and then when we started to.

name: Dorsey
line: Build tools for these people what we discovered was that the entire payments ecosystem assumed.

name: Interviewer
line: That people like our customers weren't there it just drew the line it.

name: Dorsey
line: Said we're not going to serve anybody below this line um and so what square does we started.

name: Interviewer
line: Building new tools for ourselves first to make these connections and that collection of tools became an innovation.

name: Dorsey
line: Stack and i saw this pattern again and again and again so that's why i wrote the book.

name: Interviewer
line: Was because it's this very powerful message which is to say that.

name: Dorsey
line: By serving the underserved you can create something that's so powerful that it can you know withstand an attack.

name: Interviewer
line: From a company like amazon and ultimately grow it into something that's very very significant.

name: Dorsey
line: Thanks for that one of the reasons i personally love working here at square is that we're a mission driven.

name: Interviewer
line: Organization with a strong purpose believing that the communities we serve are our most important foundation.

name: Dorsey
line: So i'd love to hear from the two of you on um how do the connection square creates um connect with the communities.

name: Interviewer
line: We serve or how should they well i i don't think it's any different.

name: Dorsey
line: From our customer focus like we have to we have to be in tune with like who we're serving and those people.

name: Interviewer
line: Are in tune with a particular community and those communities might intersect with a bunch.

name: Dorsey
line: Of other communities that we're not aware of so i think the simplest answer to your.

name: Interviewer
line: Question it's just like to be very customer focused and one of the challenges in building.

name: Dorsey
line: Square early on was you know jim had a glass factory and would blow glass and sell it but it.

name: Interviewer
line: Wasn't his every single day like the people we were serving they were trying to.

name: Dorsey
line: Build coffee stores and they were flight instructors and there were flower carts they're going out every.

name: Interviewer
line: Single day and selling something so we weren't our customers and when you are building something.

name: Dorsey
line: Where you are your customer the next step is fairly obvious when you're not the customer.

name: Interviewer
line: The the next step isn't as much so you have to observe a lot more you have to talk with our.

name: Dorsey
line: Customers a lot more you have to understand what they're trying to do.

name: Interviewer
line: And not take direction from them because if you take direction from them you tend to get into.

name: Dorsey
line: A a situation where you're building something for a very specific.

name: Interviewer
line: Niche instead of something that's more broad-based so it's observing patterns listening.

name: Dorsey
line: Learning like what connects all the dots and then adding our own opinions on top of it and.

name: Interviewer
line: Then building ahead of our customers expectations so we to really build up a muscle of.

name: Dorsey
line: Getting better at talking with who we serve on a more regular basis and that's why we put.

name: Interviewer
line: An emphasis on customer service early on in the company jim was often found in the headphones.

name: Dorsey
line: He's wearing right now on the phone with people who are angry at us.

name: Interviewer
line: Or in rare cases thrilled with us and um in every one of those conversations we learn.

name: Dorsey
line: Something and enough of those conversations informed decisions going forward.

name: Interviewer
line: Yeah having seller dna at the core of the company was super helpful uh for instance square didn't hold any.

name: Dorsey
line: Focus groups yeah there were like no one-way mirrors um in our early days and i still think.

name: Interviewer
line: Today um we stay in touch by a very organic connection to people.

name: Dorsey
line: And what their lives are like and how they run their businesses and how intertwined those things are and.

name: Interviewer
line: You know one of the things that we saw during the pandemic which i was super proud of.

name: Dorsey
line: Was how quickly square responded to this outcry i mean companies were being shut down.

name: Interviewer
line: Little businesses were like wiped out um but the thing about little businesses is they're incredibly adaptable.

name: Dorsey
line: As long as you give them the tools they need and square was literally on a cadence.

name: Interviewer
line: Of releasing a new product on a daily basis sometimes partially you know partial releases in.

name: Dorsey
line: The middle of the day it was it was so wonderful in the you know time of the tragedy to.

name: Interviewer
line: See a company that was still connected that closely to its customers they couldn't respond that fast.

name: Dorsey
line: Uh well as we talked about at the beginning of this session square was born out of gym being unable to process.

name: Interviewer
line: A payment um so how is our developer platform an extension of that initial spark.

name: Dorsey
line: And what does it mean for square now to have third party developers helping ensure that sellers never miss a payment.

name: Interviewer
line: I think it's less about that and more about we realize it's a self-awareness that we're.

name: Dorsey
line: Not going to be able to build everything and our value is only as good as who chooses to use us and what how they.

name: Interviewer
line: Choose to own what we build in their own way so in some cases it's it's very much you.

name: Dorsey
line: Know consumer focus where i'm gonna use what you have and i'll customize it my own way.

name: Interviewer
line: Based on the tools that you give me as you go a level deeper developers come in the mix.

name: Dorsey
line: And it might be a small business that has four locations that hires an independent developer to.

name: Interviewer
line: Do something that the software doesn't do but um the functionality in the api allows.

name: Dorsey
line: Or you go a level deeper than that and you create an entire company based on.

name: Interviewer
line: The platform but it should scale to every you know every foundational level along.

name: Dorsey
line: That so uh it's you know how do we how do we build a platform that enables people to.

name: Interviewer
line: As they get more sophisticated with their understanding of what they want they can build.

name: Dorsey
line: With complete optionality with complete freedom without having to think about us at all.

name: Interviewer
line: And you know i think in both gemiini our cases like as we've learned about technology we've been able to go deeper.

name: Dorsey
line: And deeper and deeper and deeper and as the technology unfolds gracefully you can make it more powerful.

name: Interviewer
line: And as people make it more powerful square becomes more viable to those developers those customers and.

name: Dorsey
line: Also to the world so the more we can open up the more we can um.

name: Interviewer
line: We can we can give back uh in whatever way the the more people we're going to be.

name: Dorsey
line: Able to serve ultimately jim anything to add there only that you know the.

name: Interviewer
line: The humility that you have to have if you start dealing with massive numbers of customers um is is.

name: Dorsey
line: Not lost on me or this company um the the needs of the individual.

name: Interviewer
line: Businesses these are really very specific and um i love the fact that we've got a.

name: Dorsey
line: Developer community right now that's helping us meet those needs better because as jack said we can't build for.

name: Interviewer
line: Everybody but we can give an api and expose the things that we need to do uh to make.

name: Dorsey
line: Them work and i was literally in a place a couple of weeks ago where somebody had uh.

name: Interviewer
line: They were not in the united states but they bought the square hardware because our hardware was so awesome that.

name: Dorsey
line: They were using the hardware uh because it was the thing that served their need in a little community that.

name: Interviewer
line: Had been just like devastated by the pandemic and i was happy to see that.

name: Dorsey
line: You know in that case they were able to pick something from our stack and make it work.

name: Interviewer
line: That's great well we're down to our very last question and it's a big bold question.

name: Dorsey
line: I'd love to hear from the two of you what is the 5 10 and even 100 year plan for square.

name: Interviewer
line: Um well i believe that anyone who has a firm understanding of what.

name: Dorsey
line: The next five years or 10 years or 100 years looks like or how they might build is probably wrong.

name: Interviewer
line: I think the more important thing is to understand the trends and i think the trends that will affect.

name: Dorsey
line: Us the most will be artificial intelligence will be cryptocurrency and bitcoin.

name: Interviewer
line: Having a native currency for the internet will be regulatory um issues both defensive and.

name: Dorsey
line: Proactive by various governments around the world those are the things that will impact our company our business our.

name: Interviewer
line: Customers the most um and it's not a question of like having a perfect roadmap or a vision for.

name: Dorsey
line: The next five or ten years it's more about being agile enough to understand.

name: Interviewer
line: This is the trend it's obvious here's what we're going to do with it are we going to.

name: Dorsey
line: Utilize it to our advantage are we going to react it react to it and block it in a particular.

name: Interviewer
line: Way are we going to ignore it at whatever cost it's it's that understanding.

name: Dorsey
line: That i think is the most important and um for us over the next five ten years it's to me.

name: Interviewer
line: Those are the biggest trends ai cryptocurrency bitcoin and um regulatory.

name: Dorsey
line: Yeah i would just say that you know the core of this is humility the thing that you want to not do is.

name: Interviewer
line: Think you know what the future's gonna hold because if you do that you'll end up.

name: Dorsey
line: Making decisions and then you tend to cling to your decisions uh when evidence tells you otherwise.

name: Interviewer
line: Uh and we've seen that you know in the last year uh played out uh i i have to really.

name: Dorsey
line: Compliment jack because before it was trendy to do remote work uh jack was at the.

name: Interviewer
line: Board of directors saying we're gonna have remote board meetings and all of our board members were like no no no.

name: Dorsey
line: We'll miss the dinners and you know larry summers gives great hugs you know and we didn't want to have this.

name: Interviewer
line: Um you know we didn't want to have our party broken up but jack was adamant.

name: Dorsey
line: That we needed to to do this and then lo and behold we got a pandemic and we don't miss a beat um uh.

name: Interviewer
line: The other thing i think is important and it's something that i watch uh through you know these little proxies is.

name: Dorsey
line: Is what's our cadence of shipping product what's a cadence of getting solutions out to customers and i've seen.

name: Interviewer
line: That cadence you know sort of tick up continually over time and that's so exciting.

name: Dorsey
line: Because what companies typically do is they get comfortable and then they go oh yeah we're just.

name: Interviewer
line: Going to sit here and ride it you know like when we started square we really looked for innovation in payments.

name: Dorsey
line: And we found nothing like the preceding decade was this complete blank as far as stuff that was.

name: Interviewer
line: Done uh and i'd say since then um square and companies.

name: Dorsey
line: You know that have been inspired hopefully by square have have really taken that innovation up and i.

name: Interviewer
line: Just love the fact that we got a developer community because that's just so many more brains.

name: Dorsey
line: On the problem although i i will say like that the year the year we started was a very.

name: Interviewer
line: Auspicious year because um 2008 2009 is when the global banking system.

name: Dorsey
line: Collapsed and we emerged from that and also bitcoin.

name: Interviewer
line: And all of cryptocurrency emerged from that moment so there was something in the air where the.

name: Dorsey
line: Financial system was ready to be questioned and we had a few answers and satoshi had a few.

name: Interviewer
line: Answers and others had more answers as well but there was something special about that.

name: Dorsey
line: Time that i think we'll carry forth for the next few decades that you know we're gonna.

name: Interviewer
line: We're all gonna learn from and i think will uh impact the world in a positive way.

name: Dorsey
line: Couldn't agree more very excited to see what's come down the road uh well thank you so much jack and jim.
